entry.title: Incognito tab not fully incognito
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open new incognito tab 2. Visit simple page on localhost that sets via JavaScript a localStorage item 3. Open another tab in incognito 4. Visit simple page and see that localStorage is already set
# Problem Description localStorage should not be shared between incognito tabs for the same domain
# Summary Incognito tab not fully incognito
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Storage
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Update the image url for you.com
Rust/Bindgen-related build failure in some build environments
entry.content:
REPRO STEPS:
0. (Speculative/unconfirmed prerequisite) Get a glinux laptop (Lenovo P1G4). (The bug doesn't seem to repro on glinux workstations)
1. `autoninja -C out/Default unit_tests`
EXPECTED BEHAVIOR: build succeeds
ACTUAL BEHAVIOR: bindgen failure (copied from the internal https://paste.googleplex.com/5704500919140352):
``` [693/8502] ACTION //third_party/boringssl:raw_bssl_sys_bindings(//build/toolchain/linux:clang_x64) FAILED: gen/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.rs python3 ../../build/rust/run_bindgen.py --exe ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/bindgen --header ../../third_party/boringssl/src/rust/bssl-sys/wrapper.h --depfile obj/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.d --output gen/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.rs --libclang-path ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/lib --bindgen-flags no-derive-default enable-function-attribute-detection use-core default-macro-constant-type=signed blocklist-function=BIO_vsnprintf blocklist-function=OPENSSL_vasprintf rustified-enum=point_conversion_form_t allowlist-file=.\*\[\[:punct:\]\]include\[\[:punct:\]\]openssl\[\[:punct:\]\].\*\\.h allowlist-file=.\*\[\[:punct:\]\]rust_wrapper\\.h -- -DDCHECK_ALWAYS_ON=1 -DUSE_UDEV -DUSE_AURA=1 -DUSE_OZONE=1 -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_EXTENSIVE -DCR_CLANG_REVISION=\"llvmorg-18-init-17730-gf670112a-3\" -DCOMPONENT_BUILD -DCR_LIBCXX_REVISION=9d119c1f4a097b7d27210874f4eba3fc91a83a4e -DCR_SYSROOT_KEY=20230611T210420Z-2 -DOS_CHROMEOS -D_DEBUG -DDYNAMIC_ANNOTATIONS_ENABLED=1 -DBORINGSSL_SHARED_LIBRARY -I../.. -Igen -I../../buildtools/third_party/libc++ -I../../third_party/boringssl/src/include -Wall -Wextra -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wextra-semi -Wunreachable-code-aggressive -Wthread-safety -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-psabi -Wloop-analysis -Wno-unneeded-internal-declaration -Wenum-compare-conditional -Wno-ignored-pragma-optimize -Wno-deprecated-builtins -Wno-bitfield-constant-conversion -Wno-deprecated-this-capture -Wno-invalid-offsetof -Wno-vla-extension -Wno-thread-safety-reference-return -Wshadow -Werror -fno-delete-null-pointer-checks -fno-ident -fno-strict-aliasing -funwind-tables -fPIC -pthread -fcolor-diagnostics -fmerge-all-constants -fcrash-diagnostics-dir=../../tools/clang/crashreports -mllvm -instcombine-lower-dbg-declare=0 -mllvm -split-threshold-for-reg-with-hint=0 -ffp-contract=off -m64 -msse3 -Wno-builtin-macro-redefined -D__DATE__= -D__TIME__= -D__TIMESTAMP__= -ffile-compilation-dir=. -no-canonical-prefixes -ftrivial-auto-var-init=zero -O0 -fno-omit-frame-pointer -gdwarf-4 -g2 -gdwarf-aranges -gsplit-dwarf -ggnu-pubnames -Xclang -fuse-ctor-homing -fvisibility=hidden -Xclang -add-plugin -Xclang find-bad-constructs -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ref-template-as-trivial-member -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-allow-auto-typedefs -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=/third_party/dawn/ -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/logging.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/synchronization/lock_impl.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/check.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-ipc -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-raw-ptr-fields -Wheader-hygiene -Wstring-conversion -Wtautological-overlap-compare -std=c11 --sysroot=../../build/linux/debian_bullseye_amd64-sysroot -resource-dir ../../third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/lib/clang/18 -fparse-all-comments -fvisibility=default error: unsupported option '-msse3' for target 'unit_tests' error: unknown target triple 'unit_tests' panicked at bindgen/ir/context.rs:553:15: libclang error; possible causes include: - Invalid flag syntax - Unrecognized flags - Invalid flag arguments - File I/O errors - Host vs. target architecture mismatch If you encounter an error missing from this list, please file an issue or a PR! ```

entry.title: [User Feedback - Early Stable] Reports that Chrome does not open as expected on Windows in M122 early stable
entry.content:
Affected Chrome Version(s): 122.0.6261.18 beta, 122.0.6261.39
Affected Operating Systems: 10.0.19045, 10.0.22621, 10.0.22631
Issue Description + Insights/Patterns: We have a small number of feedback reports from Windows users on M122 early stable sharing that Chrome is not opening as expected. From the report details, it sounds like Chrome may be starting in the background or without an open window, as several users mention Chrome is running when checking the Windows task manager.
* Most reports mention that opening via an existing desktop or taskbar shortcut doesn't work as expected, with no Chrome windows opening. * Some reports mention that right-clicking an existing taskbar shortcut and selecting the "open new window" option allows Chrome to open as expected. * One report mentions that opening Chrome as an administrator allows Chrome to open as expected. Another report mentions that opening as administrator doesn’t work. * One report mentions that after trying to open via a shortcut and not seeing it open, when checking the Windows task manager they noticed that two Chrome processes were running. * There is no clear regional / country pattern.
Highlighted User Voice Examples (Access: http://shortn/_0E2VFlfXQ2): * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564473861 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91563768374 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564614049 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91542026515 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564108352 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564051186 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565094679 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565408738 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565574256 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566011302 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566026152 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566087093
Thanks!

entry.title: apps
entry.content:
Speed:
When Chrome is slow to startup, load a page, respond to your actions, uses too much memory, drains the device's battery quickly, becomes warm with use (or non-use), is eating up your bandwidth, or generally not performing how you would like, this is the right place to file a bug. For any other issues, please use a different template.
When filing a Speed bug, it's important to attach a trace (https://www.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/submitting-a-performance-bug) so that we can better investigate the issue.
Please specify the type of device and operating system (and version) where the problem occurs.
By using this template, you ensure it will be looked at by the right folks triaging Speed bugs. However, there is no SLA/SLO for fixing bugs or delivering features. Prioritization of this report is at the discretion of the Speed team. If you disagree with the assessment, please state your case in the bug so we can reassess.

entry.title: pointermove raised in between pointerdown and pointerup when browser doesn't have focus
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Setup that logs pointerdown, pointermove and pointerup events on element. 2. Focus a different window. 3. Click element. 4. Notice pointermove event raised in between pointerdown and pointerup. 5. Click again now that the browser window is focused, no pointermove event is raised.
# Problem Description When clicking on an element when the browser windows doesn't have focus, there will be a pointermove event (with movementX and movementY set to 0) raised in between the pointerdown and pointerup events.
Discovered the issue because we have custom drag logic using pointer events, and when the browser window didn't have focus and the user clicked the element, drag logic would start even if mouse was not moved.
# Additional Comments Can reproduce in Chrome and Edge, not Firefox.
# Summary pointermove raised in between pointerdown and pointerup when browser doesn't have focus
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>DOM
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [User Feedback - Stable] Increase in reports of “failed - virus scan failed” error from Windows in M121
entry.content:
Affected Chrome Version(s): 121.0.6167.184, 121.0.6167.185
Affected Operating Systems: Multiple Windows (10.0.14393, 10.0.15063, 10.0.22621)
Issue Description + Insights/Patterns: We have a large increase in feedback about downloadings not working, and a large increase in feedback reporting the error message “failed - virus scan failed”. We believe these are related, with only a subset of users reporting the full error message.
* Reports seem to be primarily from the latest stable respin. * Reports first began around February 14th, and increased on February 15th. * There doesn’t appear to be a clear pattern indicating a specific site or type of download is impacted.
Feedback Visuals: * Download Failures: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8t5QEzWRoHV9vAQ.png * Virus Scan Failures: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AFvwTmKTVgVD9aH.png
Highlighted User Voice Examples (Access: http://shortn/_0E2VFlfXQ2): * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565729425 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565712960 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565696762 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565696907 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565577421 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565522493 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564822182
Thanks!

entry.title: [CSC] Snap-back zoom-level when capture stops
entry.content: When capture stops, reset any changes to zoom-levels made through the Captured Surface Control APIs. This avoids the concern that some users might not know how to change zoom-level through Chrome's own UX, and might not be able to make changes otherwise.

entry.title: DevTools automatically showing
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Monitor and alert on bad builds
entry.content:
ClusterFuzz has a concept of bad builds, where if a binary fails to run entirely, it is blocklisted and subsequently not re-used (except for issue 325449826).
Currently, unless someone like machenbach@ goes looking for bad build errors in the ClusterFuzz GCP logs, there is no way to notice that "too many" builds are being marked as bad.
Such failures can ultimately prevent individual from doing any fuzzing anymore, e.g. TSAN in issue 40286858.
We should be able to automatically monitor that builds are working well enough, and automatically alert when they don't. I'm leaving the issue title a bit vague, as figuring out exactly what to monitor and when to alert is part of the scope here.
We could monitor:
* the age of the latest non-bad build for each job and/or fuzzer * the proportion of bad builds (compared to all builds) over the last X hours for each job and/or fuzzer * the rate of bad build errors thrown by tasks for each job and/or fuzzer

entry.title: Handle fast termination session processing for multiple browser states
Update session storage migration for multiple browser states.
Record WillResignActive metrics for all browser states in AppState
ClusterFuzz should not try running fuzz task on bad builds
entry.content:
Quoting ahijazi@ from https://crbug.com/40286843#comment6:
> Clusterfuzz already updated the build metadata on bad build detection. These builds are excluded from the list of builds checked for regression and progression. The issue here is mostly with fuzz task. We could probably skip scheduling fuzz tasks on revisions that are already known as bad. And maybe issue a log during preprocess if the last 10 (or any other number) most recent builds for this job were marked as bad.
This sounds like a great idea, and I'm surprised to learn that fuzz task can be scheduled on bad builds.

entry.title: Do foregrounding service updates in AppState for each browser state.
Flush cookie store at app launch for each browser state.
linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg complains about --es-staging argument
entry.content:
From https://crbug.com/40286843#comment5:
> I was looking at recent Bad Build failures and noticed that many of the `linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg` runs fail with bad build due to a bad argument `--es-staging` > > The error message is: Failed to open '--es-staging' > > See for example: https://pantheon.corp.google.com/logs/query;query=jsonPayload.message%3D%22Bad%20build%20for%20linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg%20detected%20at%20r92276.%22%0AjsonPayload.task_payload%3D%22fuzz%20ochang_js_fuzzer%20linux_asan_v8_inspector_dbg%22%0AjsonPayload.created%3D%222024-02-12T16:04:08.908559Z%22;cursorTimestamp=2024-02-12T16:04:08.909294536Z;startTime=2024-02-10T06:42:47.525Z?project=google.com:clusterfuzz&e=-13802955&mods=logs_tg_prod
Assigning to clemensb@ based on https://crbug.com/40154636#comment19.

entry.title: Notify the Enterprise Idle Service for every browser state.
IDXGIKeyedMutex::AcquireSync used potentially incorrectly
entry.content:
IDXGIKeyedMutex::AcquireSync may return WAIT_ABANDONED, which isn't treated as FAILED(hr), according to documentation [1]. It even explicitly states: "AcquireSync can also return the following DWORD constants. Therefore, you should explicitly check for these constants. If you only use the SUCCEEDED macro on the return value to determine if AcquireSync succeeded, you will not catch these constants."
I've also checked manually, WAIT_ABONDONED and WAIT_TIMEOUT values return false if passed to FAILED() macro.
I've found several usages of AcquireSync, where the result is checked only via FAILED macros:
MediaFoundationEncodeAccelerator https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/windows/media_foundation_video_encode_accelerator_win.cc;l=2034;drc=581b9e8403fdba9f33cc315c56180f841407c86b
DXGISharedHandleManager https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:gpu/command_buffer/service/dxgi_shared_handle_manager.cc;l=153;drc=bb018692bdebc129615f82ef8009d4c9d1e7c33f
DAWN/SharedTextureMemoryD3D https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/src/dawn/native/d3d/SharedTextureMemoryD3D.cpp;l=73;drc=ee224b663bbbd61650d528530768f9b6d247ff8c
DAWN/ExternalImageDXGIImpl https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/src/dawn/native/d3d/ExternalImageDXGIImpl.cpp;l=177;drc=208ce394095cff453d85f5d7070a6fa8c2970dac
[1] https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/dxgi/nf-dxgi-idxgikeyedmutex-acquiresync

entry.title: enumerateDevices doesn't resolve while the camera is busy in another app
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6304.0 Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: Windows 10 Version 22H2
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open chrome with --enable-features=MediaFoundationCameraUsageMonitoring (2) Open the camera in another app (like firefox), for instance on https://webrtc.github.io/test-pages/src/single-video/. (3) Open a new tab in chrome, run const devices = await navigator.mediaDevices.enumerateDevices();
What is the expected result? The call should resolve.
What happens instead? It waits undefinitely. If you close the camera in the other app, for instance by closing the firefox tab with the above website, the promise resolves.
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: When Inducing crash or restarting chrome browser on chromebook(octopus) the device is landing on sign in page.
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 120.0.6099.294 (Official Build) (64-bit) / 15662.94.0 (Official Build) ltc-channel octopus
**Note:** 1. This is a **device specific** issue happening only on Bobba(Octopus) and not able to repro on Babymega(Coral), Pantheon(Nami), Morgan(Snappy) & Homestar(Strongbad).** 2. Issue is not repro when doing rendered crash(chrome://crash).
Steps to repo: **Scenario 1: when Inducing the browser crash** 1. Launch chrome with the version 120.0.6099.294 on channel LTC on device Octopus 2. Give chrome://inducebrowsercrashforrealz in chrome browser url and press enter 3. Observe the screen
**Scenario 2: when restarting the chrome browser** 1. Launch chrome with the version 120.0.6099.294 on channel LTC on device Octopus 2. Give chrome://restart in chrome browser url and press enter 3. Observe the screen
**Actual result**: Upon Inducing browser crash and chrome restart, device is landing on "sign in to your chromebook" page
**Expected result**: Upon Inducing browser crash and chrome restart, device should land on Home page and restore your previous apps pop up should be shown.
**Crash Report ID: ad5b3b8cf4d23e52** for debugging.
Account used for testing: doolapalli.lts01@managedchrome.com
Please find the [video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jua3NeG1_WAfbzXAZihqRty_zeYoQZ_g/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-ESU_ixhLPioSzAvK2ekL_Q) for **Scenario 1**
Please find the [video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1klCOMyT9RAzvi0gKmIX0gKOz3cY33vOs/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-OyzaecqTHIwvsSFbvKscUg) for **scenario 2**
Please find the [video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d-RRnBe5v5qxyJJVvDEy7yKCP5NLwITh/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-GBjGyLn0ye3APpGgYPHcXA) where the Induce browser crash and chrome restart working as expected.

entry.title: Cannot call sidepanel.open from chrome.omnibox.onInputEntered event listener in Chrome Extension.
AccessDeniedException for multiple packages
entry.content:
I am getting the Access Denied Exception repeatedly while trying to build ChromeOS Package for ELM board. I have two different accounts, both accounts showing the same error. For the Issue1 (described below) error does not stop the build process but it slows down a lot. I guess the slow down is the result of the retries and timeout period. However, for Issue2 (please check the details below) the build stop unless I disabled corresponding packages from building. I have followed the chromium guild https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/HEAD/developer_guide.md for setting up my environment. Regardless, I have documented the whole build process for convenience in the attached doc "ChromeOS_Setup_Guide.pdf". //############################################################# Issue 1: This errors does not stop the build //############################################################# To build the package I have used the following command. Command: cros build-packages --board=elm --accept-licenses=Google-TOS Error Log: I am sharing here the snippet of the error log. For a detailed log please check the attached build.issue.log. !!! Error fetching binhost package info from 'gs://chromeos-prebuilt/board/elm/postsubmit-R123-15766.0.0-94254-8757181215527506353/packages' !!! FETCHCOMMAND_GS failed Fetcher exited with a failure condition. 13:14:08.751: INFO: run: /usr/lib/python-exec/python3.8/python3 /mnt/host/source/.cache/common/gsutil_5.23.tar.gz/gsutil/gsutil -o 'Boto:num_retries=10' cp -v -- gs://chromeos-prebuilt/board/elm/postsubmit-R123-15767.0.0-94284-8757124967434024881/packages/Packages /tmp/tmp1v0bs_nr.tmp 13:14:10.091: WARNING: GS_ERROR: b"AccessDeniedException: 403 AccessDenied\nAccessDeniedAccess denied.
overlay.oak.private@gmail.com does not have storage.objects.list access to the Google Cloud Storage bucket. Permission 'storage.objects.list' denied on resource (or it may not exist).
\n" Manually running gsutil with Account1 (faijur.rahman@imgtec.corp-partner.google.com): faijur@DevPC:~/chromiumos$ gsutil cp gs://chromeos-prebuilt/board/elm/postsubmit-R123-15766.0.0-94254-8757181215527506353/packages/Packages /tmp/tmphas56o4l.tmp AccessDeniedException: 403 faijur.rahman@imgtec.corp-partner.google.com does not have storage.objects.list access to the Google Cloud Storage bucket. Permission 'storage.objects.list' denied on resource (or it may not exist). Manually running gsutil with Account2 (faijur.rahman@imagination.corp-partner.google.com): faijur@DevPC:~/chromiumos$ gsutil cp gs://chromeos-prebuilt/board/elm/postsubmit-R123-15766.0.0-94229-8757228763066510913/packages/Packages /tmp/tmpu8ww_gki.tmp AccessDeniedException: 403 faijur.rahman@imagination.corp-partner.google.com does not have storage.objects.list access to the Google Cloud Storage bucket. Permission 'storage.objects.list' denied on resource (or it may not exist). //############################################################# Issue 2: This error stops the build //############################################################# Apart from the Issue 1, I also could not build the following three packages: 1) chromeos-base/chromeos-default-arc-apps 2) chromeos-base/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm 3) ml_service? ( chromeos-base/ml-cmdline ) I have attached the patches which I used to disable those packages to finish build. Error for package chromeos-base/chromeos-default-arc-apps: Downloading 'gs://chromeos-binaries/HOME/bcs-cheets-private/project-cheets-private/chromeos-base/chromeos-default-arc-apps/chromeos-default-arc-apps-1.2.16.tbz2' 14:43:17.164: INFO: run: /usr/lib/python-exec/python3.8/python3 /mnt/host/source/.cache/common/gsutil_5.23.tar.gz/gsutil/gsutil -o 'Boto:num_retries=10' cp -v -- gs://chromeos-binaries/HOME/bcs-cheets-private/project-cheets-private/chromeos-base/chromeos-default-arc-apps/chromeos-default-arc-apps-1.2.16.tbz2 /var/cache/chromeos-cache/distfiles/chromeos-default-arc-apps-1.2.16.tbz2.__download__.tmp 14:43:32.699: WARNING: GS_ERROR: b"AccessDeniedException: 403 AccessDenied\nAccessDeniedAccess denied.
overlay.oak.private@gmail.com does not have storage.objects.list access to the Google Cloud Storage bucket. Permission 'storage.objects.list' denied on resource (or it may not exist).
\n" 14:43:32.700: INFO: Potential list of tracker files: ['download_TRACKER_0e71a4f36473eac4beaa759d1cbeee8abd78def1._.tmp__JSON.etag'] Error for package chromeos-base/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm: Downloading 'gs://chromeos-binaries/HOME/bcs-elm-private/overlay-elm-private/chromeos-base/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm-0.0.1-r5.tbz2' 17:02:14.176: INFO: run: /usr/lib/python-exec/python3.8/python3 /mnt/host/source/.cache/common/gsutil_5.23.tar.gz/gsutil/gsutil -o 'Boto:num_retries=10' cp -v -- gs://chromeos-binaries/HOME/bcs-elm-private/overlay-elm-private/chromeos-base/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm-0.0.1-r5.tbz2 /var/cache/chromeos-cache/distfiles/chromeos-touch-firmware-elm-0.0.1-r5.tbz2.__download__.tmp 17:02:28.889: WARNING: GS_ERROR: b"AccessDeniedException: 403 AccessDenied\nAccessDeniedAccess denied.

- Error output: ../../content/browser/preloading/prerender/prerender_browsertest.cc:7982: Failure Value of: prerender_observer.was_activated() Actual: false Expected: true

entry.title: authentication_service.mm is missing build dependency to /ios/chrome/browser/sync/model
entry.content:
The ios file ios/chrome/browser/signin/model/authentication_service.mm includes ios/chrome/browser/sync/model/sync_setup_service.h but the build target does not depend on ios/chrome/browser/sync/model.
Not declaring this dependency prevents seemingly unrelated code changes from landing, usually due to linker errors.
Adding the dependency is non-trivial because it would otherwise create a circular dependency.
One possible solution could be to move AuthenticationService to a dedicated build target.

entry.title: Missing build dep in /ios/chrome/browser/history/model
entry.content:
/ios/chrome/browser/history/model:model should depend in /ios/chrome/browser/sync/model because ios/chrome/browser/history/model/web_history_service_factory.cc includes ios/chrome/browser/sync/model/sync_service_factory.h.
Not declaring this dependency prevents seemingly unrelated code changes from landing, usually due to linker errors.
Adding the dependency is non-trivial because it would otherwise create a circular dependency.
Assigning tentatively to sczs@, only listed owner.

entry.title: Emscripten-compiled WebGPU example has started to AwwSnap.
entry.content:
The attached WebGPU sample deterministically causes an Aww, Snap dialog on my Chrome, but it didn't do that before.
To run, spin up an ad hoc web server and visit buffer_map_sync.html.
It may be possible that the code does something wrong, although some months ago it used to work. Even if this is a case of bad code, I'm hoping that it should not at least fail to Chrome tab crashing.
The code is compiled from the following source code: https://github.com/juj/wasm_webgpu/blob/main/samples/buffer_map_sync/buffer_map_sync.c

entry.title: Non-Regression: Unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay when 'On-Screen Keyboard' is enabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 121.0.6167.188/15699.66.0 Stable-channel on Bobba(Octopus) device Lacros Version: LaCrOS Canary #123.0.6304.0[LaCrOS Only] OS: Chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Test account and Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes, enrolled with Corp account 3)Devices: ANon-Corp device Lava(Coral) - X86/lacros64 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: Yes( 121.0.6167.188/15699.66.0) 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Launch Lacros -> Open multiple tabs(more than 8) and close few tabs(4-5) (2) Now enable 'On-Screen Keyboard' from Accessibility menyu at Uber Tray (3)Open NTP and observe virtual keyboard gets popped up -> now click on 'Search tabs' (4)Scroll down and observe unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' (Please refer Video)
Expected: Should be able to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay Actual: Instead unable to view all tabs available at 'Recently closed' in 'Searchb Tabs' overlay
This is Non-Regression issue seen from M111 #111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 stable-channel on Lava(Coral) device

entry.content:

# Problem Description We have a basic proxy authentication with credentials from kerberos ad. The macbook is connected and working well in active directory, the only issue we have is that Chrome is asking the user everytime he accesses a website the username and password for proxy authentication. All our macs have this issue. I cannot understand why it does not pass them automatically because also the user logged into the mac is from active directory.

entry.title: Chrome perf graphs and pinpoint disagree
entry.content:
We've been using the chrome perf graphs to continuously track performance on benchmarks. We're also using pinpoint to evaluate potential improvements.
We've always assumed that what we see on pinpoint should mostly match what we later get on the graphs once a CL lands. Although we know not to expect an exact match, I've recently learned that the disparity between perf graphs and pinpoint is match worse than expected.
I've been specifically evaluating the perf of a V8 feature called MinorMS (which is enabled on field trial). To do that I compare, for example, the perf graphs for Speedometer2 (which runs with the MinorMS feature enabled) against the graph for Speedometer2-nominorms (which uses the same configuration as Speedometer2 but explicitly disables the MinorMS feature via --js-flags). You can see the graphs in [1] (skia UI) and [2] (legacy UI). The graphs claim that running with MinorMS regresses the benchmark score by ~1%.
However, if I run the same comparison on pinpoint (see [3] and [4], each with over 100 attempts to average out noise), I see that running with MinorMS improves the benchmarks by ~0.5%-0.8%.
This disparity is significant and completely changes the picture.
Obviously one of the results is wrong, but it is very much unclear to me which of them is the wrong one. At the moment, I find myself unable to trust either results and thus without any reliable way to evaluate the performance of our work.
[1] https://chrome-perf.corp.goog/e/?queries=benchmark%3Dspeedometer2%26bot%3Dlinux-perf%26master%3DChromiumPerf%26stat%3Dvalue%26subtest_1%3DSpeedometer2%26test%3DRunsPerMinute&queries=benchmark%3Dspeedometer2-nominorms%26bot%3Dlinux-perf%26master%3DChromiumPerf%26stat%3Dvalue%26subtest_1%3DSpeedometer2%26test%3DRunsPerMinute&requestType=0&selected=commit%3D1261284%26name%3D%252Cbenchmark%253Dspeedometer2-nominorms%252Cbot%253Dlinux-perf%252Cimprovement_direction%253Dup%252Cmaster%253DChromiumPerf%252Cstat%253Dvalue%252Csubtest_1%253DSpeedometer2%252Ctest%253DRunsPerMinute%252Cunit%253Dunitless_biggerIsBetter%252C&showZero=false&summary=true [2] https://chromeperf.appspot.com/report?sid=47385ad496521d3cdd0e8979faf60056a0d069b7ad81d1e9f181264966e402a1 [3] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/1275ca53ee0000 [4] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/11dc10afee0000

entry.title: Change DevTools waterfall rotation email
entry.content:
It seems that something broke since december with Gerrit sending emails to go/rotation oncalls.
DevTools uses devtools-waterfall-sheriff-onduty@grotations.appspotmail.com as the oncall email, but sheriffs no longer receive any email updates.
E.g we used to get emails for the devtools-internal -> Chromium roll (example CL: https://crrev.com/c/5299888)
In the go/rotation UI there is now an update that the `@rotations.google.com` suffix is preferred. Manually uploading CLs and adding the two mail addresses has confirmed that `@rotations.google.com` works, whereas the appspotmail doesn't.
We should update all existing usages of the appspotmail with the newer address. Priority-wise we should start with the roll CLs that require Sheriff review.

entry.title: Improve reusing `ShapeResult` while editing
entry.content:
We have two different ways to "reuse existing `ShapeResult`". This issue is for tracking reviews on the reuse for editing.
The first "reuse" is built in `InlineItemsBuilder`, which tries to use previous `InlineItem` and `ShapeResult` where it's safe and possible to reuse. This improves 2nd or later layouts.
The second "reuse" is for editing. While editing text, Blink internally uses functions in [`CharacterData`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CharacterData), such as `appendData`. In this case, text changes so it needs reshape, but we know how text changes, so there's an optimized code path to avoid marking `NeedsCollectInlines` for every character.
These edit operations go to [`InlineNode::SetTextWithOffset`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/inline/inline_node.cc;l=924?q=InlineNode::SetTextWithOffset&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) to adjust `InlineItem` and `ShapeResult` without fully reshaping. This type of reusing is implemented in `InlineNodeDataEditor` and `ReusingTextShaper`. In short, this runs `CollectInlines` and patches the `ShapeResult`.
One difficulty exists here, it's not very easy to use the knowledge of "how it's edited", because editing happens on DOM, while shaping needs to handle white-space collapsed text. To solve this difficulty, [`InlineNodeDataEditor::Run()`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/inline/inline_node.cc?q=InlineNodeDataEditor::Run&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) compares the two white-space collapsed text, before and after the edit.
This method has a different difficulty, because it's a simple string comparison to find a difference by `std::mismatch`, it may sometimes make a wrong guess, such as issue 40879986, as [discussed here](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5285603/comment/9250a5a1_0d2e4f14/).
